name: Hyperbolic-graph-generator
tagline: A tools to generate synthetic graphs embedded into a hyperbolic space.
body:
### Welcome to the Hyperbolic Graph Generator Pages.
This software implements and extends the network model described in [Hyperbolic Geometry of Complex Networks](http://arxiv.org/abs/1006.5169). Embedded in the hyperbolic plane, these networks naturally exhibit two common properties of real-world networks, namely power-law node degree distribution and strong clustering. Moreover, other well-known graph ensembles, such as the soft configuration model (SCM), Erdos-Renyi (ER) graphs, or random geometric graphs (RGGs), appear as degenerate regimes in the model. 

|                  	|      T = 0     	|     T in (0,inf)    	|        infinite T        	|
|------------------	|:--------------:	|:-------------------:	|:------------------------:	|
| γ in [2,inf) 	| Hyperbolic RGG 	| Soft Hyperbolic RGG 	| Soft Configuration Model 	|
|   infinite γ 	|  Spherical RGG 	|  Soft Spherical RGG 	|        Erdos-Renyi       	|

The user selects a regime by specifying appropriate values of γ and T. If **γ >= 10**, then γ is considered infinite. If **T >= 10**, then T is considered infinite. The threshold values of these infinities can be modified by changing the HG INF TEMPERATURE and HG INF GAMMA definitions in the *lib/hg_formats.h*.

A complete description of the Hyperbolic Graph Generator tools is available @
A brief description of the mathematical models support the Hyperbolic Graph Generator is available at

### Authors and Contributors
The Hyperbolic Graph Generator has been designed and implemented by Chiara Orsini (@chiaraorsini), and Rodrigo Aldecoa (@raldecoa). The original idea....
